result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on December 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:34 AM Defendant Robert R Pust in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Robert R Pust.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Thompson states one doctor is unavailable today. 
Atty Gutierrez requests a new date with both doctors appearing at the same time. 
State does not object.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:36 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.
Defendant Robert R Pust in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Robert R Pust. 
All parties have reviewed doctors report.
State is in agreement with the doctors report. 
Defense objects to doctors report and requests a hearing. 
Court conducts colloquy with defendant and defendant states he is competent. 
Court sets a competency hearing.
Confirmed with Dr Westendorf on date.  (zoom information provided)
Competency hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:10 AM Defendant Robert R Pust in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Robert R Pust.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Court will order a further evaluation in this matter.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 21, 2022
Signed competency order
proposed competency order

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C/Witness D listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come onto the property of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

02:36 PM Defendant Robert R Pust in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  Court sets matter for a review hearing before the Trial Court.  Review hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
